condition.narrative: The Borrower will furnish IDA a report of such audit by said auditors, of such scope and in suchdetail as IDA shall havereasonably requested

title.narrative: Acceptance and implementation of Banking Application by BB

comment.narrative: BB does not have Banking Application system.
Banking application fully functional at BB

The Banking application is fully functional at BB. The Core Banking solution is used for: all banking transactions ofgovernment,banks and financial institutions; Reserve Management; vault operation and cash management; and sale, encashment, couponpayment, andreimbursement of all government Savings Certificates. The Treasury module is used for international reserve management;and the Market Infrastructure module is used for: auction; secondary sale and purchase; REPO; Reverse REPO; security transfer; andfund settlement. Electronic fund transfer operation for government salary payments has started for 1,611 officials of 17ministries includingthe Prime Minister's Office.

title.narrative: Acceptance and implementation of ERP by BB

comment.narrative: BB does not have ERP system.
ERP fully functional at BB.

ERP is fully functional at BB. All HR functions, such as, recruitment, transfer, promotion, payroll and Provident Fund Managementare done through HR module of SAP.Financial management and accounting are done through FICO module of SAP. All procurement, andmaintenance of asset inventory are done through MM module of SAP. Regular Financial Statements are generated from ERP and bookclosingis completed in SAP.

title.narrative: Acceptance and implementation of Data Warehouse by BB

comment.narrative: BB does not have any Data Warehouse.
Data Warehouse fully functional at BB.

Enterprise Data Warehouse (EDW) is fully operational at BB. Banks are submitting all the returns and reports through onlineweb-based application of EDW. All other financial institutions are submitting their returns via Rationalized Input Templatesdirectly through the web portal. Many reports are currently generated from this application. A Dashboard has been developed withkey indicators so that management can get a compact view of the financial sector.

title.narrative: Timely and accurate accounting and reporting of government accounts and securities, by June 30, 2012.

baseline.value: The process of accounting and reporting of government accounts at BB are manual.

comment.narrative: Banking and ERP systems are now under implementation, and these systems will support BB to prepare timely and accurate financialstatistics.

target.value: Timely and accurate accounting and reporting of government accounts and securities

actual.value: Reporting of government accounts and securities are now timely and accurate.

comment.narrative: All the government transactions are now being processed through the Banking Application package, and the daily debit and creditscrolls of the government accounts are shared with the government in electronic form at the end of the day.

title.narrative: Systems installed in BB to capture and share data on AML/CFT, by June 30, 2012

baseline.value: Systems are manual at this stage.

comment.narrative: Installation of AML/CFT systems would wait till BB installs all its IT packages and make them functional for BB's efficientfunctioning.

target.value: Systems installed in BB to capture and share data on AML/CFT.

actual.value: The Financial Intelligence Unit (FIU) at BB is receiving Suspicious Transaction Reports (STRs) and Cash Transaction Reports (CTRs)from the banks, financial institutions and securities firms. The "goAML" software to analyze the STRs and CTRs has been installedbyUNODC in a test environment.

comment.narrative: Customization of the "goAML" software is being carried out by UNODC in a test environment. Procurement of additional hardwareincluding servers has been initiated and the hardware is expected to be delivered in December 2012. The customized software willbe transferred to the dedicated servers in December 2012.

title.narrative: Timely and accurate submission of prudential returns, by FIs and better management of foreign exchange, by BB by June 30, 2012

baseline.value: The process of submission of prudential returns by FIs are manual. Foreign exchange management is also done manually.

comment.narrative: These processes will be automated through the implementation of Datawarehose and ERP systems.

target.value: Timely and accurate submission of prudential returns, by FIs and better management of foreign exchange.

actual.value: The financial institutions are submitting their prudential reforms on a timely basis through the web portal. Reserve Managementhas improved.

comment.narrative: All the financial institutions (FIs) are submitting the prudential returns via Rationalized Input Templates directly to BB throughthe web portal. The Treasury Module under Core Banking Solution is used to better manage foreign exchange reserves.

title.narrative: Timely and accurate preparation and reporting of financial statistics, by BB by June 30, 2012.

baseline.value: Financial statistics are published with a lag of one to two years.

target.value: The lag in reporting of financial statistics brought down to three months.

actual.value: The lag in reporting of most of the financial statistics has been brought down to less than three months as banks and financialinstitutions are now submitting data, information, statements and returns through the web portal.

comment.narrative: Almost all the banks have made the changes in their systems to generate data in the required format for submission through theon-line Rationalized Input Templates (RIT). Banks and financial institutions have stopped submitting hard copies of returns andstatements from November 2012, and reporting of financial statistics is fully automated now.

title.narrative: Key staff in computer department receive adequate training.

target.value: Continuous training ensured through a regular computer training program.

actual.value: A regular computer training program, as a mandatory course, has been scheduled at the BB Training Academy for all staff. Trainingon all the IT packages has been made mandatory in the course curriculum of Foundation Course of BBTA for all new staff joining BB.

comment.narrative: All the IT packages included training of key staff in the IT Department of BB. Moreover, 30 BB officials participated in overseastraining on ERP. 265 officials were trained as end users and TOT for ERP. 50 officials from IT Department and 50 from businessdepartments were trained on EDW. 135 business users and IT officials have been trained on the Banking package. Overseas trainingcontinues to be imparted on ERP, Banking, EDW, and networking.

target.value: Implementation of BB automation component well advanced

actual.value: Implementation of BB automation completed with all the major work processes being performed in an automated environment.

comment.narrative: All the IT contracts have been implemented, except for the National Payment Switch which is expected to "go Live" by end ofDecember 2012. More than 3,500 officials are now connected in the network and have access to BB Intranet and webmail. All the BBbranchesare now connected under the same network. Printing of circulars and office orders have already been stopped and are postedin the Intranet. BB is now using e-tendering for its own procurement. Electronic Fund Transfer Network is fully operational.

baseline.value: Outdated and archaic HR policies in BB.

actual.value: HR policies have been revised and modernized.

comment.narrative: BB is using the newly developed application forms for recruitment of AD. A new promotion policy and a Recognition and Rewardpolicyhave been adopted by BB, along with a modern PMS. A Recreation Leave Policy has been implemented as a "quick win."

title.narrative: A modern performance management system in place.

baseline.value: Outdated performance management system (PMS) in place.

target.value: Modern performance management system adopted and practised.

actual.value: A modern Performance Management System (PMS) has been put in place from April 2012.

comment.narrative: The annual performance appraisal is now being conducted through PMS. BB Managers are not yet fully conversant with this process.Acompetency model has also been introduced.

actual.value: A draft of the Risk-based Inspection Manual for Banking Supervision Department has been prepared and circulated for review andcomments by the concerned BB teams.

comment.narrative: BB is being helped by the IMF's Resident Adviser to upgrade the bank supervisory policy manual in line with risk-based supervisionframework.

title.narrative: Quality research reports on vital issues prepared and disseminated by BB.

baseline.value: Research reports not up to the mark.

target.value: Policy Analysis Unit staffed to carry out quality research.

actual.value: A Chief Economist Office has been set up and headed by an ex-World Bank staff, to conduct quality research on vital issues anddisseminate them adequately.

comment.narrative: PAU is regularly publishing policy notes, working papers, Monetary Policy Review, Bangladesh Bank Quarterly, and Financial SectorReview. The PAU has published 26 policy notes, 31 working papers on various monetary, fiscal and development issues, 8 MonetaryPolicy Reviews (MPR), and 7 Financial Sector Review (FSR). Eight eminent economists from the country have been contracted toconduct research along with BB staff.
